sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SALE, a town of Tanjil county, Victoria, Austrah*a, the principal centre in the agricultural Gippsland district, on the river Thomson, 127½ m. by rail E.S.E. of Melbourne. Pop. (1901), 3462. It is the seat of the Anglican bishop of Gippsland, and contains the cathedral of the Roman Catholic bishop of Sale. Attached to its mechanics’ institute are schools of mines, art and technology, and a fine free library. The finest buildings, excluding a number of handsome churches, are the Victoria Hall and the convent of Notre Dame de Sion. The Agricultural Society has excellent show grounds, in which meetings are annually held. Sale is the head of the Gippsland lakes naviga-tion, the shipping being brought from the lakes to the town by canal. Daily communication is maintained with Cunningham at the lakes’ entrance, and ocean-going steamers ply frequently between Sale and Melbourne.
